subject: Programming
title: Depth-First Search
description: A quick, practical guide to Depth-First Search.

hook.text: Imagine exploring a maze by always turning left until you hit a dead end, then backtracking.

buildup.text: Depth-first search plunges as deep as possible before backing up and trying another path.

discovery.text: It uses a stack and needs less memory than BFS on deep graphs. It's great for detecting cycles.

twist.text: DFS doesn't find shortest paths. It might explore a long detour before finding a nearby node.

climax.text: Web crawlers use DFS to follow links deep into websites before moving to the next domain.

punchline.text: Go deep before you go wide.

quiz.question: What data structure does depth-first search use?
